alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 4:09AM AKST until February 24 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Very cold wind chills. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Large snow drifts will develop impacting travel in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill values will moderate temperatures rise today.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
